revised_title: Decomposition of Nitrogen Pentoxide at Low Pressures
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the thermal decomposition of nitrogen pentoxide at low pressures. They found that the reaction proceeded uniformly according to the unimolecular theory even in the presence of surfaces or other gases. The results showed a disturbance in the reaction rate when the total pressure in the system fell below 0.1 mm of mercury. The authors proposed a reaction mechanism where a definite fraction of activated molecules always undergo decomposition, while a larger fraction does so only if they do not collide with other molecules for a period of about a second.
